dlinmin_test.cpp

Minimizes a function of "N" variables by using derivative information. Performs a minimization of a function of variables, i.e. given as input the vectors and and the function , the function finds the scalar that minimizes . is replaced by and by .

Parameters:
p N-dimensional initial starting point for the search, is set to the point where the function takes on a minimum.
xi N-dimensional search direction, is replaced by the actual vector displacement that p was moved.
fret The function value at the new point p.
func The function that will be minimized.
dfunc The derivation of function func.
Returns:
none.
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that p is not one-dimensional or that p and xi don't have the same length
Please follow the link to view the source code of the example. The example can be executed in the example directory of package LinAlg.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1998
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
linmin.cpp

00051 //===========================================================================
00052 #include <iostream>
00053 #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
00054 #include "LinAlg/arrayoptimize.h"
00055 
00056 
00057 using namespace std;
00058 
00059 
00060 // The testfunction: 
00061 double testfunc(const Array< double >& x)
00062 {
00063     return x(0) * x(0) + 2;
00064 }
00065  
00066 
00067 // The derivation of the testfunction:
00068 void dtestfunc(const Array< double >& x, Array< double >& y)
00069 {
00070     y = 2*x(0);
00071     return;
00072 }
00073 
00074 
00075 int main()
00076 {
00077     double          fret(0.); // function value at the point that
00078                               // is found by the function
00079     Array< double > p(1),     // initial search starting point
00080                     xi(1);    // direction of search
00081 
00082     // Initialize search starting point and direction:
00083     p(0) = -3.;
00084     xi(0) = 3.;
00085 
00086     cout << "Performing a derived line minimization for function "
00087          << "f(x) = x*x + 2 "
00088          << "with starting point (-3, 11) and direction (3, 11):" 
00089          << endl << endl;
00090 
00091     // Minimize function:
00092     dlinmin(p, xi, fret, testfunc, dtestfunc);
00093 
00094     // Output of results:
00095     cout << "x-value of final point:           ";
00096     writeArray(p, cout);
00097     cout << "y-value of final point = minimum: ";
00098     cout << fret << endl;       
00099     cout << "starting point has moved to the   " << endl
00100          << "predefined direction by:          ";
00101     writeArray(xi, cout);
00102 
00103     return 0;
00104 }
